issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: Container launching code suppresses close exceptions after writes

comments.body:
This code pattern appears in the following places related to container launch:
* DefaultContainerExecutor.LocalWrapperScriptBuilder#writeLocalWrapperScript
* DefaultContainerExecutor.UnixLocalWrapperScriptBuilder#writeSessionScript
* ContainerLaunch#call
* JavaSandboxLinuxContainerRuntime#prepareContainer
Attaching patch with fixes.   Ran tests locally.
Submitting patch for testing.

This message was automatically generated.

The JUnit test that failed (testValidEnvVariableSubstitution) fails on trunk without my patch, so it is unrelated to the patch.
The checkstyle failure is another case of an empty try-with-resources block.

No new tests were added because this is fixing cases where we were not propagating an IOException that happens during the close() calls.  Isolating those failures would require pretty extensive changes.
I did run all of the existing nodemanager unit tests locally.

I think this one is ready.  Please review.
Thanks for the comments.  I have uploaded a new patch that addresses these.

The unit test failure is the same one as before.
The checkstyle issues are fixed and the review comments have been addressed.

I think this is ready for review.

Thanks for updating the patch!  The unit test failure is unrelated and tracked by YARN-7629.

+1 lgtm.  Committing this.

Thanks, Jim!  I committed this to trunk and branch-3.0.

The problem also exists in older 2.x releases, but it does not apply there.  Would you mind posting a patch for branch-2?
Will do.  Thanks!
